title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Walmart will increase its minimum wage to $12 an hour and raise pay for hundreds of thousands of its U.S. store workers.

Jobless claims fell to a new pandemic low as businesses held on to workers despite the surging Delta variant.

EU regulators fined Facebook's WhatsApp about $266 million for failing to tell the bloc's residents enough about what it does with their data.

Alibaba pledged to spend the equivalent of $15.5 billion in support of Beijing's "common prosperity" drive.

The S&P 500 and Nasdaq rose 0.3% and 0.1%, respectively, to close at records. The Dow gained 0.4%.

Ford and GM are further curtailing production as a chip shortage continues to weigh on auto makers.

Virgin Galactic won't be allowed to operate space flights until aviation regulators finish investigating an issue with its July 11 mission.

Five women and seven men were selected to serve as jurors for the trial of Theranos founder Holmes.

What's News: Business & Finance
